name: Black-breasted Thrush
description: It is slate-gray above with an orange patch on its flanks and an orange beak. The female has a whitish throat and breast with dark longitudinal streaks. The male has a black head, neck, and upper breast.
image_alt: Black-breasted thrush, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
reproduction: Females lay 3–4 eggs; incubation lasts 12–13 days.
attractions: It lives in pairs, hidden in dense undergrowth. The male also sings loudly and distinctly from the ground.
